msDesc.head: Durandus of Saint-Pourçain, Lectura super quartum librum Sententiarum Petri Lombardi. Northern France/Paris (?), s. xiv1.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1495–1498. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Durandus de Sancto Porciano
msItem.title: Commentary on Peter Lombard, Sententiae, bk. 4
msItem.note: Second recension (unpr.; Quétif–Échard, SOP, 1. 586a–587b; Little 39, citing the present MS.; J. Koch, Durandus de S. Porciano O. P. Forschungen zum Streit um Thomas von Aquin zu Beginn des 14. Jahrhunderts. Erster Teil: literaturgeschichtliche Grundlegung, BGPM 26, 1 (1927) 5–85, this copy at p. 52; Glorieux, Rép., 70d, citing the present MS.; Stegmüller, RS, 194, citing the present MS. at p. 87; Kaeppeli 927, this copy at p. 342).

supportDesc.support: parchment; with remnants of medieval repair (stitching with natural-coloured thread).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling (fols 1ra–109rb) in lead point, two columns of hand 1) 56, 2) (mostly) 54–56 and 3) c.47–53 lines. Ruled space c.220–37 143–53

handDesc.handNote: (fols 1ra–109ra, main part) French textualis, s. xiv1, by three different hands, changing at fols 13rb, l. 41 & 62rb, l. 34. The hands are related to those writing in MS. Laud Misc. 348. Corrections and marginalia mostly in the text hands.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.origin: 14th century, first half France, Northern (Paris?). The manuscript was estimated by ‘Wernherus’ from Erbach (im Odenwald, Hesse) to be sold in Paris, as suggested by the deleted, now in part illegible note at the upper margin of fol. 110v, below the ex-libris inscription of the Mainz Charterhouse, and written in the same hand: ‘[Notand]um est. quod iste liber est [c. six words heavily crossed out: ... Elizabeth [?] de fratribus ... de ...]. et est estimatus. per wernherum | […]m de Erbach filium [...] prout carius vendi [?] posset parisius ad […]’.
history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the top centre of fol. 110v: ‘fratrum Cartusiensium prope mogunciam.’ Identifiable as D XIII S in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 1r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 523 Quarto Catalogue, p. 583 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 53

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1495–1498

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Laud Misc. 737, endleaf (fol. i r-v)

msItem.title: Carthusian Statutes
msItem.note: Text unidentifiable. Leaf of scrap parchment, written on both sides, reused as front flyleaf.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in ink, two columns of 29 lines; single horizontal and vertical bounding lines, extending the full height, probably also width of the page; the ruled space c.251–53 183 , each column c.85–88 mm, the intercolumnar space 9–10 mm.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
